themes: overreliance on hotel occupancy tax for arts funding
arts as intrinsic community value beyond economic development
need for private sector involvement in arts funding
vulnerability of cultural organizations to city-level funding decisions
key_phrases: funding programs that are not exclusively tied to hotel occupancy taxes
basing art funding on tourism can prioritize larger organizations
arts are not just economic development tools or tourism tools
incentivize private funds coming into our non-profit arts sector
connect the creative class to private corporations and businesses
do not have to rely and sink or swim based on funding decisions at the city level
barriers_identified: exclusive reliance on hotel occupancy tax for funding
solutions_proposed: create funding programs not tied exclusively to hotel occupancy taxes
incentivize private funds for the non-profit arts sector
develop systems connecting the creative class to private corporations and businesses
